intro: Ilex subtilis, commonly known as the Chinese holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, glossy dark green leaves. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Ilex subtilis typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded garden environments.
